features.name: caches
features.description: Spec. Test.
details: Edge:

features.name: caches.open
features.description: The open() method of the CacheStorage interface returns a Promise that resolves to the Cache object matching the cacheName.

features.name: caches.delete
features.description: The delete() method of the CacheStorage interface finds the Cache object matching the cacheName, and if found, deletes the Cache object and returns a Promise that resolves to true. If no Cache object is found, it returns false.

features.name: caches.has
features.description: The has() method of the CacheStorage interface returns a Promise that resolves to true if a Cache object matches the cacheName.

features.name: caches.add
features.description: The add() method of the Cache interface takes a URL, retrieves it and adds the resulting response object to the given cache.

features.name: caches.addAll
features.description: The addAll() method of the Cache interface takes an array of URLS, retrieves them, and adds the resulting response objects to the given cache. The request objects created during retrieval become keys to the stored response operations.

features.name: caches.delete
features.description: The delete() method of the Cache interface finds the Cache entry whose key is the request, and if found, deletes the Cache entry and returns a Promise that resolves to true. If no Cache entry is found, it returns false.

details: Not all options supported until Chrome 54

features.name: caches.keys
features.description: The keys() method of the Cache interface returns a Promise that resolves to an array of Cache keys.

details: Not all options supported until Chrome 54

features.name: caches.match
features.description: The match() method of the Cache interface returns a Promise that resolves to the Response associated with the first matching request in the Cache object. If no match is found, the Promise resolves to undefined.

details: Not all options supported until Chrome 54

features.name: caches.put
features.description: The put() method of the Cache interface allows key/value pairs to be added to the current Cache object.

features.name: postMessage to & from worker
features.description: Spec. Test.

details: You can use this on UC. But you should be careful. Their implementation on event.source, clients.matchAll and MessageChannel.port1.addEventListener are not good. You should avoid this because they may cause bug or just be useless.
Failed. And i got the message on window.
Lack of event.source in serviceWorker thread
Chrome & Opera: messageEvent.source is null within the worker, but you can pass your own MessageChannel for 2-way communication. [fixed in 43]
Chrome & Opera: Incorrectly delivers messages to window.onmessage rather than navigator.serviceWorker.onmessage.[fixed]

features.name: PushManager.subscribe()
features.description: spec。Test。

details: add applicatonServerKey in Chrome 52
It all runs well unless it was not blocked by GFW in China. But firefox work.

features.name: PushManager.permissionState()
features.description: The permissionState() method of the PushManager interface returns a Promise that resolves to a DOMString indicating the permission state of the push manager. Possible values are  'prompt', 'denied', or 'granted'.

features.name: PushManager.getSubscription()
features.description: The PushManager.getSubscription() method of the PushManager interface retrieves an existing push subscription.It returns a Promise that resolves to a PushSubscription object containing details of an existing subscription. If no existing subscription exists, this resolves to a null value.

features.name: subscription.unsubscribe()
features.description: The unsubscribe() method of the PushSubscription interface returns a Promise that resolves to a Boolean when the current subscription is successfully unsubscribed.

features.name: Background sync
features.description: Debounce user's request until coonnected Spec。 Test。

features.name: Debugging
features.description: State of debugging tools.

details: You can debug service worker scripts as any other. "Application" panel in devtools has service worker & cache sections.
Debuggable from the "Workers" page in about:debugging.
Web Console can display console messages from Service Workers.
about:serviceworkers has some under-the-hood stuff.
Debuggable from the resources panel in Opera developer if you enable super-experimental devtools.
Console messages from the service worker appear in the pages' console in Opera stable.
browser://serviceworker-internals in Opera developer has some under-the-hood stuff.
Chrome & Opera: Debuggable from the resources panel in Chrome Canary and Opera developer if you enable super-experimental devtools.
Chrome & Opera: Console messages from the service worker appear in the pages' console.
Chrome & Opera & Samsung Internet: chrome://serviceworker-internals resp. browser://serviceworker-internals (in Opera developer) has some under-the-hood stuff.
